entry.note: This message is a remedy to be appended to our unsupported error messages. The full error message will be: 'Use of {0} is not supported on a thread-based worker. Use alternatives supported on the background pool.'

message.entry: {0} Use alternatives supported on the background pool.
Creating arrays of parallel pools is not supported.
Changing the MATLAB path is not supported on a thread-based worker.
Files must be specified as a character vector or a cell array of character vectors.
Failed to create parallel pool, your code will run in serial instead. To use a parallel pool, change your default cluster profile or validate it in the Cluster Profile Manager.
Invalid partition method argument. Partition method argument must be one of {0}.
Invalid value for "MaxNumWorkersPerGPU" partition method argument. Value must be a numeric scalar integer equal to the maximum number of workers per unique GPU to use.
Invalid value for "MaxNumWorkersPerHost" partition method argument. Value must be a numeric scalar integer equal to the maximum number of workers per unique host to use.
Invalid value for "Workers" partition method argument. Value must be an array of parallel.Worker instances, all of which must be members of the input parallel pool.
The parallel pool has shut down. Use parpool to start a new pool.
Invalid value. UseParallel must be "on", "off", "auto", true, or false.
Invalid value. UseParallel must be "on", "off", true, or false.
Use of a loaded parallel pool object is not supported. Avoid storing parallel pool objects in MAT files or sending them between MATLAB Sessions.
No files automatically added to the parallel pool.

No parallel pool is available for parallel execution and AutoCreate is disabled. Either create a parallel pool using parpool, set UseParallel to "auto", or modify your Parallel Settings to enable AutoCreate.
No parallel pool is available for parallel execution. Either create a parallel pool using parpool, or set UseParallel to "auto".
No parallel pool is available for parallel execution and AutoCreate is disabled. Either create a parallel pool using parpool or modify your Parallel Settings to enable AutoCreate.
Parallel functionality with parallel pools requires Parallel Computing Toolbox.
Parallel functionality with parallel pools requires a Parallel Computing Toolbox license.

entry.note: This message is a remedy to be appended to our unsupported error messages. The full error message will be: 'Use of {0} is not supported on a thread-based worker. Use a PARPOOL('Processes') process-based pool or a different process-based pool instead.'

message.entry: {0} Use a PARPOOL('Processes') process-based pool or a different process-based pool instead.
Failed to partition pool using "NumWorkersPerGPU" method. Caused by:\n{0}.
A scalar parallel pool is required as the first argument to ''{0}''.

Failed to automatically create a parallel pool with the default parallel environment. Running serially on the client instead. Fallback to serial execution will be removed in a future release. Error details:\n\n{0}
Parallel pool is unavailable because it was created in a different MATLAB session or it has been loaded from a file.
Shutdown parallel pool.
Waiting to gather gpuDevice information for each parallel pool worker. One or more required parallel pool workers are busy executing PARFEVALs. If this is expected, disable this warning using {0}.
tocBytes must be called with the same connected pool object that was used for ticBytes.
ticBytes must be called without an output argument before calling tocBytes with only a single input argument.
Argument to tocBytes must be the argument returned from ticBytes.
Syntax not supported on a thread-based pool.
Syntax not supported on a thread-based pool. Use alternatives supported on the background pool.
Syntax not supported on a thread-based pool. Use a process-based parallel pool instead.
Syntax not supported on internal pool.
Syntax not supported on the background pool. Use a Parallel Computing Toolbox pool created via parpool instead.
Thread-based pools do not support measuring bytes sent to or received from workers.
"close" not supported for parallel pool objects. Use "delete" instead.
